SystemUtils

Method Detail

getPid

public static int getPid()
Gets the PID of this process, by inspecting the runtime management MX bean. This may not be supported on all systems, in which case this method throws UnsupportedOperationException.

Returns:
the process ID
Throws:
java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - if not available

getHostName

public static java.lang.String getHostName()
Attempts to get the host name of the machine on which this process is running, through InetAddress.getLocalHost(). This may not be supported on all systems, in which case this method throws UnsupportedOperationException.

Returns:
the local host name
Throws:
java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - if not available

getOperatingSystem

public static OperatingSystem getOperatingSystem()
Attempts to determine the type of the operating system by parsing the value of the os.name system property.

Returns:
type of the OS
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the parameter cannot be parsed for any reason

getJvmName

public static java.lang.String getJvmName()
Gets a more-or-less unique name for this JVM, typically based on the process ID and machine name, though this is platform-specific.

This is equivalent to ManagementFactory.getRuntimeMXBean().getName().

Returns:
the JVM name
See Also:
RuntimeMXBean.getName()

getPresentWorkingDirectory

public static java.lang.String getPresentWorkingDirectory()

getUserName

public static java.lang.String getUserName()

getFileSeparator

public static java.lang.String getFileSeparator()
Gets the separater between components of a filename. On Windows this is '\', on Unix '/'.

Returns:
the platform file separator
